description: After all struggles with Gimp, Inkscape and Powerpoint alternatives I found this perfect program! It does exactly what I want: quick editing, cropping, transformations, freehand drawing. And it is clean and intuitive! This is finally the solution I need!
A good sotware that does what it needs.

If you work with SVGs at all, they should go through this editor at least once during the process of editing or creating them. It has great support for the most advanced elements of the SVG standard and doesn't hide the code behind abstraction. The markup is easily visible and editable.
Lately I've just been playing with some SVG drawing tools. This one at the same time looks simple, but offers you plenty of tools!
From time to time the Gnome software store recommends some gems

As someone who has Inkscape installed on my system, but never use it because it's interface is very scary, I found Boxy SVG's to be quite accessible and intuitive for an absolute beginner like me. Combine the clean interface with some really good online Youtube tutorials that you can access from the Help menu, and you can get up and going pretty quickly. I can't say how more experienced users will regard this program, but it's definitely not a toy. Give it a shot, because this is the kind of program that should be featured in the Snap Store.
Excellent. Easy to use and loads of features.
summary: Excellent. Easy to use and loads of features

description: easy to install
This program works great! However, for a simpler and handier SVG editor, you can use mBlock's sprite editor at: ide.mblock.cc
summary: Very good SVG editor nd maker!

description: User friendly. Clean and intuitive interface

Good choice for simple svg image

Nice UI. Works well.
Thanks.

If this had a usable GRID with snaping it would be usable. 

Has some nice features too bad its short sighted.

As an illustrator normally using Adobe Illustrator, I can say that this is a very competent and powerful software. The workflow is a bit weird, and could be optimized, and it's tricky to learn that the layer panel is stacked backwards (not very intuitive, the lowest layer is the highest), but that aside you can a lot of cool things with BoxySVG. It's not something I would use in production, but I play around with it on my spare time, and I am pretty impressed. If the workflow was better (it is way to slow to be useful when there is an actual deadline), I would consider using it professionally in parallell with Illustrator.

Don't miss the fact you can not only use local fonts, but you can _embed_ the fonts in the file, which means anybody with the file and Boxy can edit the text regardless if they have the font installed or not. This is really good. Also, the developer is super responsive.

description: Can't open the app in any way. The process is running, but no window pops up. Fedora 38.
Not as feature rich as Inkscape, but is very polished and has enough tools for most people to be productive in it. Very clean, simple UI, very refined, very fast. Nicely done!
Does what it needs to do, Slight annoyances, but useuable and extremely basic
I am using Wayland and Boxy is fickering all the time. It's a great tool on X, but unusable on X.

El programa es muy potente aunque le faltan cosas como la rejilla por grados y editar la punta de linea de un trazo de forma manual, agregando nodos a los costados del nodo final o de inicio de un trazo sea para afinar o engrosar la linea a gusto. Por el resto está muy bién, es muy ágil y va muy bien.-
